summary: Email chain between attorney Gloria Allred and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding scheduling a meeting for one of Allred's clients, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal prosecutors in New York on August 19, 2019. The client initially agrees but later decides not to meet.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney communicating with federal prosecutors to arrange a meeting for her client, an Epstein victim, to provide information.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Allred's assistant who is to be contacted by a federal agent to arrange travel details for the client.

connections.description: Allred instructs the federal agent to contact her assistant, Diane Aldrich, to arrange client travel details.
Attorney-prosecutor communication regarding scheduling a meeting for a victim-witness in the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Federal Prosecutors
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for Gloria Allred and her client (an Epstein victim) to meet with federal prosecutors at the SDNY office.

events.title: Client Decides Not to Meet
events.description: Gloria Allred informs the prosecutor that her client has decided she does not wish to meet with them.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Gloria Allred, a prominent attorney, was representing clients who were victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
A meeting was scheduled for August 19, 2019, between federal prosecutors and one of Allred's clients.
The client initially agreed to fly to New York for the meeting but later decided not to participate.
The correspondence highlights the challenges prosecutors faced in securing victim cooperation.
The email chain is dated August 2019, shortly after Epstein's arrest and death.
